metadata.feature_description: View and manage activity stream on user profiles

steps.action: Navigate to own profile Activity Feed at /Activity-Feed/userId/1
steps.expected: Profile page loads with Activity Feed tab showing user's posts
steps.actual: Profile page loaded successfully with SuperUser Account profile, showing Activity Feed tab with posts including privacy test posts, emoji posts, and photo posts

steps.expected: Multiple activity posts visible with Like, Comment, Subscribe options
steps.actual: Activity posts displayed correctly with all expected options and timestamps

steps.action: Navigate to Test Admin profile at /Activity-Feed/userId/4
steps.expected: Test Admin's profile page loads with their activity feed
steps.actual: Test Admin's profile loaded successfully showing their activity feed with badge earned activity and posts from other users

steps.action: Navigate to own profile and locate post input area
steps.expected: Post input area visible with placeholder 'Tell the world something...'
steps.actual: Post input area found with expected placeholder text and attachment options

steps.action: Enter post text 'Profile Activity Test Post - Jan 16 2026' and submit
steps.expected: Post should be created and appear in activity feed
steps.actual: Post created successfully and appeared at top of activity feed with correct text and timestamp

steps.action: Navigate to Test Admin profile (userId/4) and locate post input area
steps.expected: Post input area available on other user's profile
steps.actual: Post input area visible on Test Admin's profile wall

steps.action: Enter post text 'Posting to Test Admin wall - Profile test Jan 16 2026' and submit
steps.expected: Post should be created on Test Admin's wall
steps.actual: Post created successfully on Test Admin's profile wall with correct text

steps.action: Navigate to own profile and view activity feed
steps.expected: Posts with different privacy levels should be visible to owner
steps.actual: Multiple privacy test posts visible: 'Privacy test - Private visibility', 'Privacy test - Friends visibility', 'Privacy test - Community Members visibility', 'Privacy test - Everyone visibility'

steps.action: Verify all privacy levels are displayed correctly
steps.expected: Posts with Everyone, Community, Friends, and Private visibility visible to owner
steps.actual: All four privacy level posts confirmed visible: Everyone, Community Members, Friends, and Private - all displaying correctly on owner's profile

steps.action: Navigate to profile Activity Feed and locate filter dropdown
steps.expected: Filter dropdown available with activity type options
steps.actual: Filter dropdown found with options: Filter by activity, Posts, Links, Photos, Files, Forum Topics, Forum Replies, Blogs, Friends, Group Created, and more

steps.expected: Activity feed should filter to show only photo posts
steps.actual: Filter successfully applied - activity feed now shows only posts with attached images/photos

steps.action: Navigate to profile and locate post with Subscribe link
steps.expected: Posts should have Subscribe/Unsubscribe links visible
steps.actual: Found posts with 'Subscribe' links - e.g., 'Testing prohibit mode with damn profanity' post had Subscribe link

steps.expected: Subscribe link should change to 'Unsubscribe' indicating successful subscription
steps.actual: Subscription successful - link changed from 'Subscribe' to 'Unsubscribe' on the post 'Testing prohibit mode with damn profanity'

observations: Code suggests SubscribeToUserWall functionality exists for subscribing to entire user walls, but the UI only exposes post-level subscription through Subscribe/Unsubscribe links on individual posts
Activity Stream Filter sidebar allows creating custom feeds with saved filters like 'Photos and Wiki Filter' and 'Test User Filter'
Profile page shows Friend, Follow options for other users but no explicit 'Subscribe to Wall' button - subscription is per-post
Edit mode overlays were visible during testing but did not block functionality - posts could still be created and interactions worked
